description: Social Insurance Number (SIN), a 9-digit number unique to the individual. Format: 'XXXXXXXXX'.
The first/given name of the person.
The last/family name of the person.
The gender of the person: 'male', 'female', or 'non-binary'.
The date of birth in 'YYYY-MM-DD' format.
The street address including unit/apt number if applicable. Example: '123 Main Street, Unit 4B'.

The province or territory of residence. Options: 'Alberta', 'British Columbia', 'Manitoba', 'New Brunswick', 'Newfoundland and Labrador', 'Northwest Territories', 'Nova Scotia', 'Nunavut', 'Ontario', 'Prince Edward Island', 'Quebec', 'Saskatchewan', 'Yukon'.
Canadian residency status for tax purposes: 'resident', 'non-resident', 'deemed resident', 'deemed non-resident'.
The number of eligible dependents (children under 18 or other qualifying dependents).

The person's occupation or job title. Examples: 'Software Engineer', 'Registered Nurse', 'Teacher', 'Accountant', 'Server/Waiter', 'Retail Manager', 'Construction Worker', 'Marketing Manager', 'Lawyer', 'Electrician'.
The name of the person's employer/company. Leave empty if self-employed or unemployed.
Whether the person has investment accounts (stocks, dividends, etc.): true or false.
Whether the person or a dependent qualifies for the Disability Tax Credit: 'self', 'dependent', 'none'.
